actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on January 4, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Cole moved that the House do now adjourn.

actions-list.header: ANNOUCEMENT OF RESULT OF ROLL CALL 4
actions-list.actionItem: The Clerk announced that no persons having received a majority of the whole number of votes cast by surname in the Election of the Speaker, a Speaker was not elected.
Election of the Speaker. Mr. McCarthy 202, Mr. Jeffries 212, and Mr. Jordan 20 (Roll no. 4).

Pursuant to law and precedent, the Clerk directed the Reading Clerk to call the roll anew. Accordingly, the Honorable Steve Scalise of Louisiana placed the name of the Honorable Kevin McCarthy into nomination for the Office of Speaker, the Honorable Pete Aguilar of California placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker, and the Honorable Chip Roy placed the name of the Honorable Jim Jordan into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.

actions-list.header: ANNOUCEMENT OF RESULT OF ROLL CALL 3
actions-list.actionItem: The Clerk announced that no persons having received a majority of the whole number of votes cast by surname in the Election of the Speaker, a Speaker was not elected.
Election of the Speaker. Mr. McCarthy 203, Mr. Jeffries 212, and Mr. Jordan 19 (Roll no. 3).

Following the procedure used by the House in 1923, and recorded in Cannon's Precedents, volume 6, section 24, the Clerk directed the Reading Clerk to call the roll anew. Accordingly, the Honorable Jim Jordan of Ohio placed the name of the Honorable Kevin McCarthy into nomination for the Office of Speaker, the Honorable Pete Aguilar of California placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker, and the Honorable Matt Gaetz of Florida placed the name of the Honorable Jim Jordan into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.

actions-list.header: ANNOUCEMENT OF RESULT OF ROLL CALL 2
actions-list.actionItem: The Clerk announced that no persons having received a majority of the whole number of votes cast by surname in the Election of the Speaker, a Speaker was not elected.
Election of the Speaker. Mr. McCarthy 203, Mr. Jeffries 212, Mr. Biggs 10, Mr. Jordan 6, Mr. Banks 1, Mr. Zeldin 1, and Mr. Donalds 1 (Roll no. 2).
The Clerk announced the appointment of the following Members-elect to act as Tellers during the Roll Call for Election of Speaker: Mr. Loudermilk, Ms. Lee of California, Mr. Steil, and Mr. Morelle.

Pursuant to law and precedent, the Clerk announced that the next order of business was the election of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and that nominations would now be in order. Accordingly, the Honorable Elise M. Stefanik of New York placed the name of the Honorable Kevin McCarthy into nomination for the Office of Speaker, the Honorable Pete Aguilar of California placed the name of the Honorable Hakeem S. Jeffries into nomination for the Office of Speaker, and the Honorable Paul A. Gosar placed the name of the Honorable Andy Biggs into nomination for the Office of Speaker. No other nominations were put forward.

The Clerk notified the House that since the last regular election of Representatives to the 118th Congress, a vacancy now exists in the 4th District of the State of Virginia, occasioned by the death of the late Honorable A. Donald McEachin.
The Clerk notified the House that election credentials for all Delegates and Resident Commissioners had been received.
Call by States Quorum responded: 434 present (Roll no. 1).

The Clerk announced that Certificates of Election covering 435 seats in the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress had been received and the names of those persons whose credentials show that they were regularly elected as Representatives in accordance with the laws of their respective States of the United States would be called. Without objection, the Representatives-elect were directed to record their presence by electronic device in order to determine whether a quorum was present.
The Clerk led the House in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
House convened, starting a new legislative day, pursuant to the 20th amendment to the Constitution, for the meeting of the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress of the United States.
